intro: Cicuta virosa var. nipponica, commonly known as Japanese water hemlock, is a toxic member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet, marshy environments. The plant features a thick, branched rootstock and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like umbels. Due to its high toxicity, it is considered a dangerous plant and should be handled with extreme caution.
